response.original_title: California Special: Resolving McAfee "Error 0x80040154" and Agentic AI Handshake Failures
response.overview: California AI Security Desk: 1-855-508-8955 Technical Root Cause Analysis: In California’s 2026 tech ecosystem, Error 0x80040154 (Class Not Registered) is frequently caused by a failure in the Agentic AI Handshake. McAfee’s 2026 "Autonomous SOC" requires a secure DCOM link to the system's NPU (Neural Processing Unit). If a 2026 Windows 11 update or a "Fileless" malware injection corrupts the registry class for McAIClient.dll, the dashboard deadlocks. This prevents the antivirus from communicating with its own AI cores, leaving you vulnerable to Deepfake-based social engineering. Advanced Restoration Protocols: COM Registration Reset: Run regsvr32 on core McAfee AI components in an elevated prompt to re-index the registry class. NPU Driver Audit: Use Device Manager to verify the Neural Processor driver is signed for the 2026 "Trusted-AI" architecture. DCOM Permission Wipe: Re-assign "Local Activation" permissions to the McAfee Trust processes in the Component Services console.
response.tagline: California Special: Resolving McAfee "Error 0x80040154" and Agentic AI Handshake Failures
response.title: California Special: Resolving McAfee "Error 0x80040154" and Agentic AI Handshake Failures
